text: What is the primary language for styling web pages?
correctAnswer: CSS

text: What is the purpose of the 'viewport' meta tag in HTML?
options: To set the background color of the webpage
To control the width and scaling of the viewport
correctAnswer: To control the width and scaling of the viewport

text: How is a CSS class selector represented in a stylesheet?
correctAnswer: .class

text: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
What does 'CSS' stand for?
correctAnswer: Cascading Style Sheets

text: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in the 'img' tag?
options: To specify alternative text for an image
To create a link to another page
correctAnswer: To specify alternative text for an image

text: In CSS, what does the 'box-sizing' property control?
options: The size of a text box
correctAnswer: The border-box model

text: Which CSS pseudo-class is used to select the first child of an element?
correctAnswer: :first-child

text: What is the purpose of the 'z-index' property in CSS?
options: To control the spacing between elements
To set the font size of text
To define the stacking order of positioned elements
To specify the color of text
correctAnswer: To define the stacking order of positioned elements

text: What is the HTML5 semantic tag for marking up a navigation menu?
correctAnswer: <nav>

text: What is the role of a full-stack-Developer?
correctAnswer: All of the above

text: What is the purpose of a SQL JOIN statement?
options: To combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column
To filter data using a specified condition
correctAnswer: To combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column

text: What is the purpose of a Docker container?
options: To store and manage database records
To package and distribute applications with their dependencies
correctAnswer: To package and distribute applications with their dependencies

text: How does HTTP differ from HTTPS?
options: HTTP uses a secure connection, and HTTPS does not
HTTPS uses a secure connection, and HTTP does not
They are the same, and the terms are interchangeable
There is no difference between HTTP and HTTPS
correctAnswer: HTTPS uses a secure connection, and HTTP does not

text: What is the purpose of the 'await' keyword in JavaScript?
options: To create a delay in execution
correctAnswer: To make a function asynchronous

text: What is the purpose of the 'window.localStorage' object in web development?
options: To cache images for faster loading
To persistently store key-value pairs on the client-side
correctAnswer: To persistently store key-value pairs on the client-side

text: In web development, what is the purpose of the 'viewport' meta tag?
options: To set the background color of the webpage
To control the width and scaling of the viewport
correctAnswer: To control the width and scaling of the viewport

text: What is the purpose of the 'useEffect' hook in React?
options: To perform side effects in functional components
correctAnswer: To perform side effects in functional components

text: Which of the following is a NoSQL database?
correctAnswer: MongoDB

text: What does the acronym 'MERN' stack stand for in web development?
correctAnswer: MongoDB, Express.js, React, Node.js

text: What is JSX in React?
correctAnswer: JavaScript XML

text: In React, what is the purpose of the 'useState' hook?
options: To fetch data from an API
To manage and update component state
correctAnswer: To manage and update component state

text: In React, what is the purpose of the 'useEffect' hook?
options: To perform side effects in functional components
correctAnswer: To perform side effects in functional components

text: What is the significance of the 'props' object in React?
options: To pass data from a parent component to a child component
To define CSS styles for a component
correctAnswer: To pass data from a parent component to a child component

text: In React, what is the purpose of the 'key' attribute when rendering a list of components?
options: To define a unique identifier for each component
To set the font size of text
To determine the order of the components
correctAnswer: To define a unique identifier for each component

text: What is a React component?
options: A reusable piece of code that renders UI elements
A function that performs server-side operations
correctAnswer: A reusable piece of code that renders UI elements

text: What is the purpose of the 'setState' method in a React class component?
options: To update the component's state and trigger a re-render
To create a new component instance
To define the component's initial state
correctAnswer: To update the component's state and trigger a re-render

text: In React, what is a controlled component?
options: A component that is managed by Redux
A component that updates its own state directly
A component that relies on external APIs for state management
A component whose state is controlled by React through its props
correctAnswer: A component whose state is controlled by React through its props

text: What is the purpose of the 'useContext' hook in React?
options: To consume values from a React context
To manage and update component state
correctAnswer: To consume values from a React context

text: What is the 'state' in React?
options: A mechanism for managing component data
An external library for managing state
correctAnswer: A mechanism for managing component data

text: What is the purpose of the 'let' keyword in JavaScript?
options: To declare a variable with block scope
To declare a variable with function scope
correctAnswer: To declare a variable with block scope

text: How can you check the type of a variable in JavaScript?
correctAnswer: Using the 'typeof' operator

text: What is the purpose of the 'map' function in JavaScript?
options: To create a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the array
To filter elements in an array based on a specified condition
To reduce an array to a single value
To sort the elements of an array
correctAnswer: To create a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the array

text: What does the term 'hoisting' refer to in JavaScript?
options: The process of moving a function declaration to the top of the file
The process of moving variable declarations to the top of their containing scope
The process of compressing JavaScript files
The process of declaring multiple variables in a single line
correctAnswer: The process of moving variable declarations to the top of their containing scope

text: What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A way to create private variables in a function
The process of closing a JavaScript file
A method for handling errors in asynchronous code
A combination of a function and the lexical environment within which that function was declared
correctAnswer: A combination of a function and the lexical environment within which that function was declared

text: What is the purpose of the 'JSON.parse' method in JavaScript?
options: To convert a JavaScript object to a JSON string
To parse a JSON string and return a JavaScript object
To validate the syntax of a JavaScript object
To create a new JSON object
correctAnswer: To parse a JSON string and return a JavaScript object

text: What is the difference between '==' and '===' in JavaScript?
options: '==' performs type coercion, while '===' does not
'===' performs type coercion, while '==' does not
'==' is the strict equality operator, while '===' is the loose equality operator
'===' is the strict equality operator, while '==' is the loose equality operator
correctAnswer: '===' is the strict equality operator, while '==' is the loose equality operator

text: What is the purpose of the 'async' keyword in JavaScript?
options: To define a new asynchronous function
To handle errors in synchronous code
correctAnswer: To define a new asynchronous function

text: What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in JavaScript?
options: To refer to the current object in a method
To create a new instance of a class
To access the previous value of a variable
correctAnswer: To refer to the current object in a method

text: How can you prevent the default behavior of an event in JavaScript?
correctAnswer: Using the 'preventDefault' method
